"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-24 19:52:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/150f8c64e8e8517cd1bbad1a64679f3cf7d28041', 'message': "Fix force-delete on snapshot resource

When using snapshot-delete API, if the share driver
logs an exception, the status of the snapshot is set
to 'error_deleting'. If an administrator wants to remove
this snapshot, he/she would expect to use the
snapshot-force-delete API. However, if the share
driver still cannot delete the resource, it will remain
in 'error_deleting' state; leaving the administrator
with no choice but to resort to making changes to
the snapshot record in Manila's database.

Propagate the force flag to the share manager and log
driver exceptions, while ignoring them to obliterate
the snapshot on Manila's database if the delete
operation is forced.

Also fix data being sent in create/delete snapshot
driver interfaces and refactor corresponding unit tests.

commit_message:
Fix force-delete on snapshot resource

When using snapshot-delete API, if the share driver
logs an exception, the status of the snapshot is set
to 'error_deleting'. If an administrator wants to remove
this snapshot, he/she would expect to use the
snapshot-force-delete API. However, if the share
driver still cannot delete the resource, it will remain
in 'error_deleting' state; leaving the administrator
with no choice but to resort to making changes to
the snapshot record in Manila's database.

Propagate the force flag to the share manager and log
driver exceptions, while ignoring them to obliterate
the snapshot on Manila's database if the delete
operation is forced.

Also fix data being sent in create/delete snapshot
driver interfaces and refactor corresponding unit tests.

Change-Id: Ic2494e1f9eb9104f96ef3a50f12d0f304735ee4f
Closes-Bug: #1560119

commit_message:
Turn rax-ord on slowly, max to 10

We want to evaluate current cloud conditions in rax-ord.

This patch sets max-servers from 0 to 10 in rax-ord.

Change-Id: Ic3c39e52b6472766f467adb92e33074f65a9bf42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/03/301403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max-servers: 10

commit_message:
Increase Cinder oversubscription ratio in CI

Generic driver fails from time to time on Cinder not being able
to schedule shares because of exceeded size limit.
Since we do not use size in API tests at all increase
Cinder oversubscription ratio from 20.0 to 100.0
to make it enough for sure.

Such error appears from time to time and
more often with addon of new Tempest tests that create shares.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I8a14f806c0235f5a12930eee362a838404cd5c06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/72/300372/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "CINDER_OVERSUBSCRIPTION_RATIO=100.0" >> $localrc_path

commit_message:
fix OrderedDict mutated during iteration

Running unit tests of keystoneauth in Python 3.5 reveals the issue
that in Python 3.5+, keys() is not a copy, and therefore items can't
be popped from it while iterating.

This patch iterate over copy of session.adapters keys in Python2/3.

Change-Id: I4a4340d6f0b09e047e992d0a7236f83ff5eac7a3
Closes-Bug: #1565728
(cherry picked from commit 7dd4208e5c2519fa4647fd9f36b7f67bd2f11718)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/86/301186/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[WIP] Add Network IP Availability Extension

There is a feature that merged for Network IP Availability [1].
There is a patch in Neutron for adding this api extension [2]
and patch for adding commands for its usage [3].
This change basically implements new api that can be used
to check network usage stats of all the networks
or specific network created by Neutron.

Partially Implements Blueprint: neutron-ip-capacity

Change-Id: Iba198cc2ae52f1ccf8bb69176f26ce6952d4d29b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/32/297332/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument( '--ip-availability-list', action='store_true', default=False, help='List IP availability for network' ) elif parsed_args.ip_availability_list: columns = ( 'network_id', 'network_name', 'total_ips', 'used_ips', ) column_headers = ( 'ID', 'Name', 'Total IPs', 'Used IPs', )

commit_message:
Revert "[sahara-tests] create and merge, disable tests"

This reverts I72b8e0b777573fb8249c052ecfbfd213bcc87a93 , so it restores
the set of tests and the normal ACLs for sahara-tests.

Change-Id: I3b27aeaaba1b26ff17058f97703979f8b7c8460d

commit_message:
Add Bare Metal API v1

Add WADL and code samples

Source is docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/webapi/v1.html
Focus on adding ironic only.

Unchenged from previous (from patch set 37)
  The name of the common query parameters
  The description of the timestamp paramters

Change-Id: I6dc432f226ee7cb47e27296487621f75d4483b25
Closes-Bug: #1482238

Bare metal API v1 (CURRENT) Manages chassis, drivers, links, nodes, and ports for use with the Bare metal API, also known as ironic services.
API versions API versions.

commit_message:
config options: centralize section "service"

Move options from 'service' to 'conf/service.py'.

Change-Id: I621481590d93b806ea17d498a562da87207001f3
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephen.finucane@intel.com>
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

' (Disable by setting to 0)'), cfg.ListOpt('enabled_apis', default=['ec2', 'osapi_compute', 'metadata'], help='A list of APIs to enable by default'), cfg.ListOpt('enabled_ssl_apis', default=[], help='A list of APIs with enabled SSL'), cfg.StrOpt('ec2_listen', default="0.0.0.0", help='The IP address on which the EC2 API will listen.'), cfg.IntOpt('ec2_listen_port', default=8773, min=1, max=65535, help='The port on which the EC2 API will listen.'), cfg.IntOpt('ec2_workers', help='Number of workers for EC2 API service. The default will ' 'be equal to the number of CPUs available.'), cfg.StrOpt('osapi_compute_listen', default="0.0.0.0", help='The IP address on which the OpenStack API will listen.'), cfg.IntOpt('osapi_compute_listen_port', default=8774, min=1, max=65535, help='The port on which the OpenStack API will listen.'), cfg.IntOpt('osapi_compute_workers', help='Number of workers for OpenStack API service. The default ' 'will be the number of CPUs available.'), cfg.StrOpt('metadata_manager', default='nova.api.manager.MetadataManager', help='OpenStack metadata service manager'), cfg.StrOpt('metadata_listen', default="0.0.0.0", help='The IP address on which the metadata API will listen.'), cfg.IntOpt('metadata_listen_port', default=8775, min=1, max=65535, help='The port on which the metadata API will listen.'), cfg.IntOpt('metadata_workers', help='Number of workers for metadata service. The default will ' 'be the number of CPUs available.'), cfg.StrOpt('compute_manager', default='nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager', help='Full class name for the Manager for compute'), cfg.StrOpt('console_manager', default='nova.console.manager.ConsoleProxyManager', help='Full class name for the Manager for console proxy'), cfg.StrOpt('consoleauth_manager', default='nova.consoleauth.manager.ConsoleAuthManager', help='Manager for console auth'), cfg.StrOpt('cert_manager', default='nova.cert.manager.CertManager', help='Full class name for the Manager for cert'), cfg.StrOpt('network_manager', default='nova.network.manager.VlanManager', help='Full class name for the Manager for network'), cfg.StrOpt('scheduler_manager', default='nova.scheduler.manager.SchedulerManager', help='Full class name for the Manager for scheduler'), cfg.IntOpt('service_down_time', default=60, help='Maximum time since last check-in for up service'), ] ALL_SERVICE_OPTS = service_opts def register_opts(conf): conf.register_opts(ALL_SERVICE_OPTS) def list_opts(): return ('DEFAULT', ALL_SERVICE_OPTS)

commit_message:
Run Tempest plugins

We want to run Tempest tests for a maximum of projects we're testing.
Tests are moving from Tempest tree to projects tree.

It takes care of installing tempest-lib which is required system wide to
run Tempest plugin tests.

To run tests from projects tree, we need to run tox with -eall-plugin
option.

This patch aims to change the way we run tox.

It also set manage_tests_packages to True so puppet-tempest will take
care of packaging dependencies required to run Tempest plugins tests in
RDO.

Depends-On: Iac9a57c2ba006bb2a660d2b54ee05bbe68125abf
Depends-On: I8f26968b5b817ffbb9f4dc4a0cb19ca0a1ef7d3d
Change-Id: I0942a7c9456d18528a2d84e143ae056973a7674f

commit_message:
In worlddump, cover all supported version of OpenFlow protocol by ovs-ofctl

Currently ovs-ofctl command is executed for only default ofp version
(OpenFlow10).
Some Neutron's plugin uses OpenFlow13 and in that case ovs-ofctl fails.
This chage allows us to get ovs info for all ofp versions supported by ovs.
And adds dump by dump-ports and dump-ports-desc.

Change-Id: I2d3c42835a5ad0f5ebf540e8127762f466347c9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/90/290190/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_ofp_version(): process = subprocess.Popen(['ovs-ofctl', '--version'], stdout=subprocess.PIPE) stdout, _ = process.communicate() find_str = 'OpenFlow versions 0x1:0x' offset = stdout.find(find_str) return int(stdout[offset + len(find_str):-1]) - 1 ofctl_cmds = ('show', 'dump-flows') ofp_max = _get_ofp_version() vers = 'OpenFlow10' for i in range(ofp_max + 1): vers += ',OpenFlow1' + str(i) for ofctl_cmd in ofctl_cmds: for bridge in bridges: args = {'vers': vers, 'cmd': ofctl_cmd, 'bridge': bridge} _dump_cmd("sudo ovs-ofctl --protocols=%(vers)s %(cmd)s %(bridge)s" % args)
deleted_lines: for bridge in bridges: _dump_cmd("sudo ovs-ofctl show %s" % bridge) for bridge in bridges: _dump_cmd("sudo ovs-ofctl dump-flows %s" % bridge)

commit_message:
Add microversion-parse to requirements

microversion-parse is a tiny library to parse the headers used
in OpenStack for requesting a microversion. It will be used in
Nova and other services which support microversions. Its goal
is to make sure that the somewhat complex parsing logic required
for handling the headers, including backwards compatibility, is
not duplicated amongst projects.

See I9098ab8f0800fb0550887f5eff219b18addde709 for an example in
Nova.

The code is:

* maintained in openstack-infra at
  https://git.openstack.org/openstack/microversion-parse
* apache 2.0 licensed
* on pypi: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/microversion_parse

The library is not yet packaged for any of the distros because
it is five days old. Given the goals described above it's
hoped this won't be a problem.

Change-Id: Iea8bf5cc70ad24bb352347ef347be71817db3dc5

commit_message:
Set OS specific init service providers

  This commit replaces the use of the "init" provider for services with
  OS specific ones, "redhat" and "debian".

  This is to get around that fact that "init" is explicitely disabled on
  Ubuntu for Puppet 4[1] and we've seen other issues where Puppet's systemd
  provider doesn't understand "static" as a service enabled state.
  Falling back to the legacy provider that inherits from "init" should
  provide us the same functionality.

  [1] https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-5016
  [2] https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-5353

Change-Id: Ib16ef8e15cccde1ee19198eaf387daecc031450d
Closes-Bug: #1564203
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/73/299773/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: case $::osfamily { 'Debian': { $init = 'upstart' Service { name => "ceph-mon-${id}", # workaround for bug https://projects.puppetlabs.com/issues/23187 provider => $::ceph::params::service_provider, start => "start ceph-mon id=${id}", stop => "stop ceph-mon id=${id}", status => "status ceph-mon id=${id}", } } 'RedHat': { $init = 'sysvinit' Service { name => "ceph-mon-${id}", provider => $::ceph::params::service_provider, start => "service ceph start mon.${id}", stop => "service ceph stop mon.${id}", status => "service ceph status mon.${id}", } } default: { fail("operatingsystem = ${::operatingsystem} is not supported") }
deleted_lines: if $::operatingsystem == 'Ubuntu' { $init = 'upstart' Service { name => "ceph-mon-${id}", # workaround for bug https://projects.puppetlabs.com/issues/23187 provider => 'init', start => "start ceph-mon id=${id}", stop => "stop ceph-mon id=${id}", status => "status ceph-mon id=${id}", } } elsif ($::operatingsystem == 'Debian') or ($::osfamily == 'RedHat') { $init = 'sysvinit' Service { name => "ceph-mon-${id}", provider => 'init', start => "service ceph start mon.${id}", stop => "service ceph stop mon.${id}", status => "service ceph status mon.${id}", } } else { fail("operatingsystem = ${::operatingsystem} is not supported")

commit_message:
Turn off rax-ord

Currently the failure rate for nodes being created in rax-ord is
very high.

This patch takes the max_servers in rax-ord from 195 to 0.

Change-Id: Ie6c94b333d6e6f3d503b7240f7ab39b237684311

commit_message:
Generic driver: ignore VolumeNotFound in deleting

Deleting a share will bring it into error_deleting
if the volume is already deleted. And VolumeNotFound
exception is raised. The fix will ignore the exception
and print a warning.

Change-Id: I82d70b9997a689dd3fd8eefad7dc14c39f9d275a
Closes-Bug: #1563226

commit_message:
Add explicit dependencies to pass puppet4

  This commit will add explicit dependencies in some resources in the
  provision profile.

  Without this change the CI does not pass on Puppet 4 because of the
  change in default run order.

 Depends-On: Ib16ef8e15cccde1ee19198eaf387daecc031450d
 Change-Id: Iedfa6f78936676ba54ebb888734a3b381a2378e7

Change-Id: I02471a93d4eebf76e8d19824d29b4f805f0fbb5f

commit_message:
rxtx factor should be a float

The rxtx factor on compute flavors is a float in the API. OSC is
currently blocking float values.

Change-Id: Ifa9c14825f388d2821ff4b63ab8ae83fa9c8d88b

commit_message:
Make git clean actually remove covhtml

This makes `git clean -df` actually remove the covhtml
directory and contents if you've run `tox -e coverage`.

commit_message:
Fix tempest tests list

Running command `testr list-tests zaqar` under tempest directory
get an empty list instead of the list of zaqar tempest list. This
patch set bath_path to the top directory of zaqar.

Change-Id: I8c91b83bfb5da37a95d6a797f1882221ccdc437a
Closes-Bug: #1563925

subject: Fix MTU setup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 18:34:18.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_network/common_config.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/common-config_spec.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/server-config_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_network/server_config.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/e9743b90a273dbb1b6932b65734ffa2f76022fd5', 'message': 'Fix MTU setup

For Mitaka, global_physnet_mtu should be set instead of
network_device_mtu. Additionally, path_mtu and global_physnet_mtu should
be equals to underlay MTU (physical_net_mtu).

Relates: I9eb5df274e5d7f1f89c5f894526d07d20d4cd794
Change-Id: I2cab3ae0ffa12c1cf731659059fce0ed3ff513db
Closes-Bug: #1559063
'}]
commit_message:
Fix MTU setup

For Mitaka, global_physnet_mtu should be set instead of
network_device_mtu. Additionally, path_mtu and global_physnet_mtu should
be equals to underlay MTU (physical_net_mtu).

Relates: I9eb5df274e5d7f1f89c5f894526d07d20d4cd794
Change-Id: I2cab3ae0ffa12c1cf731659059fce0ed3ff513db
Closes-Bug: #1559063
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/09/300609/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: } $physical_net_mtu = pick(get_transformation_property('mtu', $iface[0]), '1500') path_mtu => $physical_net_mtu,

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 18:45:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/14f04f67e1f3d8e09da33a5367435097ead60dc4', 'message': "Make Flavor create() and destroy() work against API DB

This makes Flavor.create() always create new flavors in the API DB,
and destroy delete from either (favoring the API DB first, like the
rest of the methods).

Now that we're this far, it also adds functional tests for the basic
operations of create, save, query, and destroy for flavors. It does
these both for flavors in the main database and the API database,
to prove that they work for both (except for create, which is always
against the API DB now).

Note that this also removes a couple of tests for reading deleted
flavors, which are now no longer legit cases across the board.

Related to blueprint flavor-cell-api

commit_message:
Make Flavor create() and destroy() work against API DB

This makes Flavor.create() always create new flavors in the API DB,
and destroy delete from either (favoring the API DB first, like the
rest of the methods).

Now that we're this far, it also adds functional tests for the basic
operations of create, save, query, and destroy for flavors. It does
these both for flavors in the main database and the API database,
to prove that they work for both (except for create, which is always
against the API DB now).

Note that this also removes a couple of tests for reading deleted
flavors, which are now no longer legit cases across the board.

Related to blueprint flavor-cell-api

Change-Id: Id5fc2f95179beb9fd057a37744815a8e640e0c32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/294758/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: f = objects.Flavor.get_by_id(ctxt, flavor.id) objects.Flavor.get_by_name, ctxt, flavor.name)
deleted_lines: def test_can_read_deleted_types_using_flavor_id(self): # Ensure deleted flavors can be read when querying flavor_id. inst_type_name = "test" inst_type_flavor_id = "test1" inst_type = flavors.create(inst_type_name, 256, 1, 120, 100, inst_type_flavor_id) self.assertEqual(inst_type_name, inst_type.name) # NOTE(jk0): The deleted flavor will show up here because the context # in get_flavor_by_flavor_id() is set to use read_deleted by # default. flavors.destroy(inst_type.name) deleted_inst_type = flavors.get_flavor_by_flavor_id( inst_type_flavor_id) self.assertEqual(inst_type_name, deleted_inst_type.name) def test_read_deleted_false_converting_flavorid(self): """Ensure deleted flavors are not returned when not needed (for example when creating a server and attempting to translate from flavorid to instance_type_id. """ flavors.create("instance_type1", 256, 1, 120, 100, "test1") flavors.destroy("instance_type1") flavors.create("instance_type1_redo", 256, 1, 120, 100, "test1") instance_type = flavors.get_flavor_by_flavor_id( "test1", read_deleted="no") self.assertEqual("instance_type1_redo", instance_type.name) objects.Flavor.get_by_id, ctxt, flavor.id)

Deprecate baymodel attribute ssh_authorized_key

We cannot remove this attribute since Heat is using it. This patch
fixes it.

commit_message:
Update docs for reading conf files

This patch updates the documents for how to parse configuration
files within Castellan. It is attempting to be consistent with
how other projects achieve the same thing.

Change-Id: Idd0621da37d2ea5193ee0da9e6ee81f803a005cd

commit_message:
Added information about plugins data into astute.yaml

Added information about plugins scripts and plugins repositories.
This information will be used by puppet to create repositories and
synchronise plugins scripts.

Change-Id: Ie2df470a4f05b73162144f9c87d1023760b282c7
Closes-Bug: 1565061

commit_message:
Use . between node and provider info in hostnames

So that it's clear what is node specific and what is provider specific,
treat the provider name as a DNS sub-domain.

Change-Id: I03abf787ed471e3cf78167fe04243155d597d390

commit_message:
tempest_plugin: fix incorrect test_dir

test_dir was using a wrong path, it was including "zaqar/tests/" while it
should not be needed, since we compute the base_path with Python and
join both base_path & test_dir later.

This patch will allow to run zaqar tempest tests and avoid this issue:
ImportError: Start directory is not importable:
'/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/zaqar/tests/zaqar/tests/tempest_plugin/tests'

Change-Id: I49ade5d51796f1cda00a3a49554f241bc91eaad2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/17/301217/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: test_dir = "tests/tempest_plugin/tests"

commit_message:
Libvirt ping: treat empty remote_ip_prefix as open

If a security group rule is created without a remote_ip_prefix,
Neutron treats it as open, 0.0.0.0/0, but the Libvirt ping check
detection code has been excluding null remote_ip_prefix entries.
This change will treat a null remote_ip_prefix in a security rule
as fully-open, 0.0.0.0/0, increasing the umbrella of inclusion for
performing ping checks.

Change-Id: I0ed45fb131879548f2d93bef2ea2b5402fc0ef6a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 10:56:28.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/e0ca9755482232d588181b02ebd502f609148d79', 'message': 'Ensure the OpenStack gate has access to the logs

When the gate fails, for any reason, its possible the logs generated

which is used to guarantee the gate has access to the logs by recursively

Change-Id: I3eece015060dd99aceb7a39ca62c5cb1a0162421

commit_message:
Ensure the OpenStack gate has access to the logs

When the gate fails, for any reason, its possible the logs generated
by the services are not accessible by the jenkins worker which does
cause problems when the logs are uploaded for analysis. To ensure the
gate always has access to the logs a trap was added to the gate script
which is used to guarantee the gate has access to the logs by recursively
setting the mode to 0777 on all files within the "/openstack/logs"
directory.

The function "gate_job_exit_tasks" has been added to the
script-libraries.sh file

Change-Id: I3eece015060dd99aceb7a39ca62c5cb1a0162421
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6eb3c34a17cf2ad0ceae8cdff55569b999369f13)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/41/301041/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [[ "${OSA_GATE_JOB:-false}" = true ]] && gate_job_exit_tasks [[ "${OSA_GATE_JOB:-false}" = true ]] && gate_job_exit_tasksfunction gate_job_exit_tasks { [[ -d "/openstack/log" ]] && chmod -R 0777 /openstack/log }
deleted_lines: # Check if the logs link is in place. This will only be true when the # environment was built by the gate-check-commit script. if [ -h $(dirname ${0})/../logs ]; then # Ensure that all directories may be traversed by all users, and that # all files are readable by all users. chmod --recursive o+rX $(dirname ${0})/../logs fi

subject: Add retry logic to mysql_upgrade

commit_message:
Add retry logic to mysql_upgrade

This change adds a retry to the mysql_upgrade command when performing
an upgrade. This is required in circumstances when the wsrep service
is not ready for application use. This is a common issue when restarting
the mysql service after package installation.

Example Error:
  Got error: 1047: WSREP has not yet prepared node for application
  use when selecting the database

Re-Implementation-Of: Icd859531b6a6f1e04ecd1214eb7c401fa0fe8048
Change-Id: I9b82415feab8b291a4b54aa10deaca4dccc34ab3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/21/293821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: register: galera_mysql_upgrade until: galera_mysql_upgrade | success retries: 3 delay: 10

commit_message:
Add API doc for misc trove operations

This  commit adds the following items that were missing
from the API doc for trove:

trove root-disable
trove detach-replica

trove create -- add the following missing args:
type
replica_of
replica_count
datastore
datastore_version
configuration

***

It also changes the following existing doc
for the following reasons:

in dbaas.wadl and ch_database-v1.xml-->

listConfigDefaults -- really belongs under a
separate "configuration" resource.

Because otherwise, it has the same signature as
"show instance details," which is not right.

***

in common.ent -->

databaseRequestParameter

The databases arg is optional when you create
an instance -- so required should be false.

datastoreNameTemplateParameter

Description used to read "The name of the data
store for which to list versions."

But now this param is used to get other stuff than
versions, so it needs to be more general, like
this:

"The name of the data store."

Change-Id: I24c7e772cd31f4362a277c54e63e9ced34b46de8
Partial-Bug: #1376972

commit_message:
Fix conversion of config disks to qcow2 during resize/migration

finish_migration contains some code which converts raw disks to qcow2
when moving from a host which uses raw disks to a host which uses
qcow2 disks. This was erroneously also converted config disks, which
are hard-coded to be raw even when other disks are qcow2.

This has always been broken, but it wasn't previously exposed because
a subsequent bug unconditionally overwrote the qcow2 config disk with
a new, raw one. Change I03e08fae97416ebe5cdedcf238a06d1b90203c5d
changed the order of these 2 events, so that the erroneously-converted
config drive was no longer overwritten, resulting in a qcow2 file
being presented to the instance as raw.

This change explicitly filters out config disks from conversion.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(mriedem): The test conflict is due to fbe31e461 not being in
stable/liberty (converting legacy image_meta dicts to ImageMeta
objects).

Change-Id: I6bf3cd4f9e0e152bf69732d9a17f93c86dedbd40
Closes-Bug: #1558343
(cherry picked from commit 29fb0aca1623eb0c4a565d728501667a4c5e8136)
(cherry picked from commit 23a202eee87a14b152e25eac1f9b6a0aa14a2bd3)

commit_message:
Fix upgrade bug in versioned_writes

Previously, versioned_writes assumed that all container servers would
always have the latest Swift code, allowing them to return reversed
listings. This could cause the wrong version of a file to be restored
during rolling upgrades.

Now, versioned_writes will check that the listing returned is actually
reversed. If it isn't, we will revert to getting the full (in-order)
listing of versions and reversing it on the proxy.

Change-Id: Ib53574ff71961592426cb386ef00a75eb5824def
Closes-Bug: 1562083

commit_message:
re-org existing manually install notes

- move enabling service notifications into own section
- clean up copy/paste install instructions
- add note to inform performance boast by disabling message signing
- add note to inform API is not required if Gnocchi is used.
- remove verbose notes
    - zmq not ready
    - how to use PasteDeploy
- move customisation possibilites into it's own page

Change-Id: I9f64a92cf22ebdd439798751ad0acc2417dfe0d3

The Libvirt plugin currently does not differentiate between IPv4
and IPv6 addresses, so since the 'ping' and 'fping' commands lack
IPv6 support, ping checks against v6 addresses will fail.  Adding
IPv6 support would likey first require verification that 'ping6' or

commit_message:
Restrict libvirt VM ping check to IPv4

The Libvirt plugin currently does not differentiate between IPv4
and IPv6 addresses, so since the 'ping' and 'fping' commands lack
IPv6 support, ping checks against v6 addresses will fail.  Adding
IPv6 support would likey first require verification that 'ping6' or
'fping6' commands exist on the host, but that will be pursued as a
future enhancement.  In the meantime, this change will restrict ping
tests to IPv4 only.

Change-Id: Icbc6281994cb5b4087e56376f47d3954e1c50c04

commit_message:
Merge branch 'tempest-sahara-api-move'

Import the existing Sahara API tests from Tempest with the complete history
of their changes (albeit filtered). The set of commits was imported in
the orphan branch that is going to be merged with this change.

Further commits will expose those tests throught the Tempest Plugin
interface.

Change-Id: Ibd618469dc7610eeda5d93cda025d711094a4206

designed in that it exposes this internal id. Luckily, flavor creation
is infrequent and flavor migration is fast.

Related to blueprint flavor-cell-api

Change-Id: Iea063448f43da1043d16dd521d255dd29a0e1bc5

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-23 00:47:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/71972838f39da3738afb868fee358825440a316b', 'message': 'Block flavor creation until main database is empty

This makes Flavor.create() fail until the main database has had all
of its flavors migrated. Since we want to avoid any overlap or clashes
in integer ids we need to enforce this. The flavor API was poorly
designed in that it exposes this internal id. Luckily, flavor creation
is infrequent and flavor migration is fast.

The flavors in our database are hard-coded in the first migration,
which means we have to basically do the migration during every
unit test in order to avoid having a legacy environment. Since that
leaves us with deleted flavors in the DB (which screws up the DB
archiving tests), this adds a hard_delete flag to the migration to
do an actual purge of those from our database. What a mess.

Related to blueprint flavor-cell-api

Change-Id: Iea063448f43da1043d16dd521d255dd29a0e1bc5

commit_message:
Block flavor creation until main database is empty

This makes Flavor.create() fail until the main database has had all
of its flavors migrated. Since we want to avoid any overlap or clashes
in integer ids we need to enforce this. The flavor API was poorly
designed in that it exposes this internal id. Luckily, flavor creation
is infrequent and flavor migration is fast.

The flavors in our database are hard-coded in the first migration,
which means we have to basically do the migration during every
unit test in order to avoid having a legacy environment. Since that
leaves us with deleted flavors in the DB (which screws up the DB
archiving tests), this adds a hard_delete flag to the migration to
do an actual purge of those from our database. What a mess.

Related to blueprint flavor-cell-api

Depends-On: I8ab03af9d2f4974f26a7f8487ec978caea957e45
Change-Id: Iea063448f43da1043d16dd521d255dd29a0e1bc5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/295310/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.db.sqlalchemy import models as main_models @staticmethod @db_api.main_context_manager.reader def _ensure_migrated(context): result = context.session.query(main_models.InstanceTypes).\ filter_by(deleted=0).count() == 0 LOG.warning('Main database contains %(count)i unmigrated flavors', {'count': result}) return result if not self._ensure_migrated(self._context): raise exception.ObjectActionError( action='create', reason='main database still contains flavors')

subject: Fixed issue where default issue tests were being ignored by child tests

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 17:59:50.000000000', 'files': ['syntribos/tests/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/syntribos/commit/87d26ce200bab6997d2bd7af760d7ee34b842669', 'message': "Fixed issue where default issue tests were being ignored by child tests

commit_message:
Fixed issue where default issue tests were being ignored by child tests

Credit to ccneill for finding this issue. Before, some issues were being
superseded, such that the issues defined in base_fuzz weren't run because
the tests stopped upon seeing an AssertionError in tests that inherited from
base_fuzz. Now, an AssertionError is only raised after all issues are tested.

Change-Id: I4e433286fc07fc5a38d06f48579e9f258529d13a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/syntribos refs/changes/11/298911/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shouldRaise = False shouldRaise = True if shouldRaise: raise AssertionError

commit_message:
Use install_package when preparing LVM driver installation

Use the install_package function from devstack instead of
calling the different package managers from distros.
Also support installation on SUSE based systems.

Change-Id: I575769aa972d7e123e79d0955d4618c09f1559d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/22/299322/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_package nfs-kernel-server nfs-common samba install_package nfs-utils nfs-utils-lib samba elif is_suse; then install_package nfs-kernel-server nfs-client samba
deleted_lines: sudo apt-get install -y nfs-kernel-server nfs-common samba sudo yum install -y nfs-utils nfs-utils-lib samba

subject: DVR: Fix issue of SNAT rule for DVR with floating ip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 11:10:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/144e2794c005a8a5eefe57b655bded73e47fa08a', 'message': 'Fix issue of prevent SNAT rule for DVR with floating ip

With current code, there are 2 issues.

1) The prevent snat rule that is added for floating ip will be cleaned,
when restart the l3 agent. Without this rule, the fixed ip will be SNAT
to floating ip, even if the network request is to an internal IP.

2) The prevent snat rule will not be cleaned, even if the external device(
rfp device) is deleted. So, when the floating ips are removed from DVR
router, there are still dump rules in iptables. Restart l3 agent can clean
these dump rules.

The fix in this patch will handle DVR floating ip nat rules at the same step
to handle nat rules for other routers(legacy router, dvr edge router)

Change-Id: I018232c03f5df2237a11b48ac877793d1cb5c1bf

1) The prevent snat rule that is added for floating ip will be cleaned,

The fix in this patch will handle DVR floating ip nat rules at the same step

After the change in [1], the fip nat rules for external port have been

commit_message:
DVR: Fix issue of SNAT rule for DVR with floating ip

With current code, there are 2 issues.

1) The prevent snat rule that is added for floating ip will be
cleaned, when restarting the l3 agent. Without this rule, the fixed
ip will be SNATed to floating ip, even if the network request is to
an internal IP.

2) The prevent snat rule will not be cleaned, even if the external
device(rfp device) is deleted. So, when the floating ips are removed
from DVR router, there are still dump rules in iptables. Restarting
the l3 agent can clean these dump rules.

The fix in this patch will handle DVR floating ip nat rules at the
same step to handle nat rules for other routers(legacy router, dvr
edge router)

After the change in [1], the fip nat rules for external port have
been extracted together into a method. Add all rules in that method
in the same step can fix the issue of ping floating ip, but reply
with fixed ip.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286392/

Change-Id: I018232c03f5df2237a11b48ac877793d1cb5c1bf
Closes-Bug: #1549311
Related-Bug: #1462154

commit_message:
Merge branch 'tempest-sahara-api-move'

* tempest-sahara-api-move: (38 commits)
  Use tempest.lib code in tempest
  Remove MapR 4.0.1 tempest test
  [sahara] adding new plugin versions to sahara tempest tests
  Fix H404/405 violations for api tests(1/3)
  Full response for DataProcessingClient methods
  Use the prefix-embedded rand_name method
  Initial class creds creation in test base class
  Remove redundant calls to clear_isolated_creds
  Decouple Sahara templates test from vanilla plugin
  Remove migrated utils code
  Add UUIDs to all tempest tests and gate check
  Drop the legacy and un-used _interface
  Change tempest NotFound exc to tempest-lib exc
  Change data_processing client to return one value and update tests
  Split resource_setup for data_processing tests
  Allow to specify the list of sahara enabled plugins
  Migrate data_processing API tests to resource_* fixtures
  Sahara: add API tests for jobs
  Sahara: preparations for job tests
  Add client response checking for data processing service
  ...

Change-Id: I9ec89e8353883b132238ba0d2a629cc737725637

Manage Neutron AAS test packages when Neutron is available

Add missing testing packages for Neutron services.
Change-Id: I8f26968b5b817ffbb9f4dc4a0cb19ca0a1ef7d3d

added_lines: describe "should install aodh tests package" do context 'with when managing tests packages for neutron (optional service)' do let :params do { :manage_tests_packages => true, :neutron_available => true } end describe "should install neutron and *aas tests packages" do it { expect { is_expected.to contain_package('python-neutron-tests') } } it { expect { is_expected.to contain_package('python-neutron-fwaas-tests') } } it { expect { is_expected.to contain_package('python-neutron-lbaas-tests') } } it { expect { is_expected.to contain_package('python-neutron-vpnaas-tests') } } end end

commit_message:
Add Container Volume Model into Kubernetes Heat Templates

Previously,the kubernetes bay type did not support the Magnum Container
Volume Model. This patch adds support for volume through the following:

1. Add volume_driver, region_name to
kubernetes bay type.
2. Update kubernetes unit tests to support container volume.
3. Update kubernetes heat templates for container volume model.

Note: The Container Volume Model of Kubernetes need the
kubernetes Version >= 1.1.1 and docker version >= 1.8.3
Change-Id: I8f568087f8e8254cb14a81edb526e596da33abcc
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-integrate-with-cinder

commit_message:
ironic-agent postinst fails on systemd with no iptables

Where the base install for the image uses systemd but
the iptables service is not present, the postinstall
script for the ironic-agent element can fail. This is
due to 'systemctl disable iptables.service' returning
an error status when the service isn't present. Check
whether the service is enabled using 'systemctl
list-unit-files'.

Change-Id: I8069b062a27caead4097747d7aeae24a5262e117
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/97/295597/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $(systemctl --no-pager list-unit-files iptables) =~ 'enabled' ]]; then systemctl disable iptables.service fi

commit_message:
Disable Protractor tests and enable strictDi

This disables the Protractor E2E tests due to a high failure rate
related to a protractor/chrome bug [1] where ChromeDriver would
frequently hang. The E2E tests were mainly used to check for
dependency injection failures, but they didn't catch all (or even
most) failures. Instead, this enables angular's built-in 'strictDi'
mode, which will raise errors during normal development (i.e.
non-production builds) and during unit tests whenever a bad injection
is used.

[1] https://github.com/angular/protractor/issues/2419

Change-Id: I825986a3df457326a6c0c0c3b4d8584617a9d5e2

commit_message:
deploy openstackclient and make our providers requiring it

* Deploy python-openstackclient, required by our providers to execute
  CLI against Glance & Neutron APIs.
* Require the package before trying to execute the providers.

Change-Id: I3b3523d947421583a8e926a2419055a5869291d4

commit_message:
Magnum's tox test should respect upper-constraints

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

Change-Id: I962329075b11d3790dc586ba33fe19fc64f1e4f9
Closes-Bug: #1563038
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/66/300066/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(NiallBunting) Infra does not support constraints for the cover # job. While the file is set no file is there. Can be removed once infra # changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Return 406 when passing non-json Accept headers on Secret GET

Currently when a Secret GET is performed without the payload
remainder, if Accept Headers are passed, the payload may be
returned, or a 500 Error will be thrown if there is no
payload. According to API this is not the intended flow.
Accept Headers anything other than "application/json" should
return a 406.

Examples:
GET /secrets/{uuid} -> 200
GET /secrets/{uuid} Accept: application/json -> 200
GET /secrets/{uuid} Accept: text/plain -> 406
GET /secrets/{uuid} Accept: application/octet-stream -> 406

Change-Id: I953adbe8f6edd5111d7470410b5567fb87da86af
Partial-Bug: #1561701

commit_message:
Fix Manage API synchronous call

RPCAPI call to Scheduler to perform share_type and host
validation should be asynchronous so share can be
created in DB with status "manage_error" if validation
is not successful.

This change also addresses incorrect exception type in API
and DB popping fields from supplied parameter.

APIImpact

Closes-bug: #1561139
Change-Id: I928f1d6b5657098f9d2b7917e2e334a1f08903f8

deleted_lines: def manage_share(self, context, share_id, driver_options, request_spec, def _manage_share_set_error(self, context, ex, request_spec): self._set_share_state_and_notify( 'manage_share', {'status': constants.STATUS_MANAGE_ERROR}, context, ex, request_spec) share_ref = db.share_get(context, share_id) try: self.driver.host_passes_filters( context, share_ref['host'], request_spec, filter_properties) except Exception as ex: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): _manage_share_set_error(self, context, ex, request_spec) else: share_rpcapi.ShareAPI().manage_share(context, share_ref, driver_options)

subject: Traceroute to git.o.o in net-info macro
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 18:35:49.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/bd9ef5a0b6cab31b0702633007b0ec4599cea858', 'message': 'Traceroute to git.o.o in net-info macro

From time to time we see network connectivity issues from instances
to various destinations. Particularly negative impact occurs if jobs
can't reach the main git mirror, since they pretty much all need to
check it for updates to whatever repo(s) they use. It's helpful, in
these instances, to be able to provide traceroutes from the affected
instances so that our providers can diagnose potential issues within
their networks.

Explicitly guard these commands with "|| true" in case they're not
installed, so as to avoid my earlier mishap.

This reverts commit d3ef853513dbda43d5fffa6337de28c0422f650d.

Change-Id: I8943f90f9e849610b26f909cbafbb0d1dc9adad2
'}]
commit_message:
Traceroute to git.o.o in net-info macro

From time to time we see network connectivity issues from instances
to various destinations. Particularly negative impact occurs if jobs
can't reach the main git mirror, since they pretty much all need to
check it for updates to whatever repo(s) they use. It's helpful, in
these instances, to be able to provide traceroutes from the affected
instances so that our providers can diagnose potential issues within
their networks.

Explicitly guard these commands with "|| true" in case they're not
installed, so as to avoid my earlier mishap.

This reverts commit d3ef853513dbda43d5fffa6337de28c0422f650d.

Change-Id: I8943f90f9e849610b26f909cbafbb0d1dc9adad2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/81/301281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Route to Git mirror..." echo "======================" traceroute6 -n git.openstack.org \ || traceroute -n git.openstack.org \ || true

Add smt state config option for ppc64

When deploying a ppc64el compute node, smt needs to be turned off
for libvirt/kvm use.

commit_message:
Tests: convert self.fail -> AssertionError

I'm not sure whether self.fail exists (pylint says no),
but raising an AssertionError is the standard way to do
this.

Change-Id: I297286c198b26f6affd7631649d289e811cc1f9e

Clarify one-per-cloud network values

Make it clear in the docs that default_interface and nat_destination can
each be set only once per cloud.

commit_message:
devstack: move rabbit conf settings to separate section

As oslo.messaging has deprecated the use of messaging config settings
in the [DEFAULT] section and we have moved rabbit conf settings to
separate section in our conf.sample, we should make the same changes
in devstack/plugin.sh

Change-Id: I24bda6f1e27370af39e9d51ab29785c9652861b7

commit_message:
Added graph_type support to the PUT -> /deployment_tasks handlers:

`graph_type` request string parameter support is added to the following handlers:

* `PUT /clusters/<cluster_id>/deployment_tasks/`

* `PUT /releases/<release_id>/deployment_tasks/`

Change-Id: Iec210248b456e921815475e1bbafadcf738af18d
Partial-Bug: #1563851

commit_message:
tox tests should respect upper-constraints.txt

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

The post jobs can not use constraints file, so override the install
command there.

Change-Id: I4776140ee20ccbddb219c87cb613d48460c3b98e
Closes-Bug: #1563038
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum-ui refs/changes/35/300935/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(shu-mutou) The setting of the install_command in this location # is only required because currently infra does not actually # support constraints files for the post job, and while # the environment variable UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is set, there is # no file there. It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(shu-mutou) The setting of the install_command in this location # is only required because currently infra does not actually # support constraints files for the post job, and while # the environment variable UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is set, there is # no file there. It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(shu-mutou) The setting of the install_command in this location # is only required because currently infra does not actually # support constraints files for the post job, and while # the environment variable UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is set, there is # no file there. It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(shu-mutou) The setting of the install_command in this location # is only required because currently infra does not actually # support constraints files for the post job, and while # the environment variable UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is set, there is # no file there. It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}# NOTE(shu-mutou) The setting of the install_command in this location # is only required because currently infra does not actually # support constraints files for the post job, and while # the environment variable UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is set, there is # no file there. It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}
